definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In the afternoon, I will go out and play tennis with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 在下战书，我去，我和朋侪打网球。

sentences.english: Let me see. She has 30 minutes on Tuesday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 让我查查，她周两下战书有30分钟。

sentences.english: Well, we'll send tea into the room when the visitors come.
sentences.chinese: 下战书我有几位朋侪来访，请给加些热水瓶和茶杯。

sentences.english: We have supper at six afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 我们下战书六点进晚餐。

sentences.english: Fellow teachers good afternoon, I am very pleased to attend the interview.
sentences.chinese: 列位教师下战书好，很快乐能参与此次面试。

sentences.english: Since your reservation is not guaranteed, it can only be kept for you until 6 P. M.
sentences.chinese: 您的预订并无担保，因此只能为您保留到下战书6点。

sentences.english: He threw down the gauntlet and I accepted his challenge.
sentences.chinese: 挑战书，并答应与他决斗。

sentences.english: Good afternoon, madam. May I help you ?
sentences.chinese: 下战书好，夫人。能为您效劳吗？

sentences.english: I'm going to call a plumber to come this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 我将叫一个管道工今日下战书来。

sentences.english: This afternoon my classmates and I went to help the drivers clean the buses.
sentences.chinese: 今天下战书我和同砚们去资助司机叔叔洗濯车辆。

sentences.english: Yesterday afternoon I went to . It happened that I saw a touching event.
sentences.chinese: 昨天下战书我去越秀公园，可巧我看见一件动人的事。

sentences.english: The tea party began at half past six.
sentences.chinese: 茶会下战书六点半开端。

sentences.english: One afternoon he went out with Arthur to the University of California .
sentences.chinese: 有一天下战书，他随阿瑟一同到加得福尼亚大学去。

sentences.english: Every day I studied my new lessons on textbooks in the morning and did my homework in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 天天我上午学书中的新知识，下战书做功课。

sentences.english: And so the gauntlet is now thrown down.
He went back to America on a summer afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他于一个炎天的下战书前往了美国。

definition: credentials (of a diplomat)/documents exchanged between nations/national or dynastic history book
to challenge an opponent to a fight
letter written in one's own blood, expressing determination, hatred, last wishes etc
peaceful measures before using force (idiom); diplomacy before violence/jaw-jaw is better than war-war
